Validate Send Coins Request to Another Wallet

POST /v1/wallet/send/validate

The endpoint serves the purpose of validating a request to send coins to another wallet before executing the actual transaction.

The API provides functionality for conducting transfers, allowing users to specify either the recipient’s wallet address or phone number.

Request

Body

Parameters

Media Type: application/json

  • address: string (required) Represents the recipient’s wallet address.

  • phone: string (required) Represents the recipient’s phone number.

  • amount: integer (required) Represents the amount of coins to be sent.

  • currency: string (required) Specifies the currency in which the coins are denoted.

Example body

{
  "phone": "+447871236668",
  "amount": 31,
  "currency": "USDT"
}

Request Sample: cURL

At the time of sending the request, the curl command should be as follows:

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.vault.sandbox.testessential.net/v1/wallet/send/validate \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzdWIiOiIwNTFhYTc3Mi0yNDk4LTQ0ZTEtODdmYi0zYzNhZDdlMTY1ODgiLCJleHAiOjE3MTE3ODM4OTYsImlhdCI6MTcxMTY5NzQ5Nn0.GBWhOHEIbiOipMa1kXMsamNqT1I6pFBe3-gZ3me1bM4' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "phone": "+447871236668",
  "amount": 31,
  "currency": "USDT"
}'

Responses

200 - Success Response

The response status code indicates that the request was successfully processed.

possibleToExecute: boolean (required)

Indicates whether the transaction is possible to execute.

Default: true

possibleToExecute: boolean (required)

Indicates whether the transaction is possible to execute. Default: true

blockedAmount: object (required)

Information about any blocked amount.

value: integer (required)

Numeric value representing the blocked amount.

currency: string (required)

Currency of the blocked funds.

Responses example

{
  "blockedAmount": {
    "value": 0,
    "currency": "EUR" },
  "possibleToExecute": true
}

400 - Bad Request

The response status code indicates that the requested page was not found on the server.

message: string

Message displayed to the user.

field: string

Specifies the field in the request that caused the error.

errorId: integer

Identifier of the error.

systemId: string

Identifier of the component.

originalMessage: string

The original error message.

errorStackTrace: string

The place where the error occurred in the code.

data: object

Additional data related to the error, structured as key-value pairs.

  • additionalProp1: object

  • additionalProp2: object

  • additionalProp3: object

error: string

Identifier of the error.

Responses example

{
  "error": "COMMON",
  "errorId": 0,
  "message": "Sorry for inconvenience. We're fixing the issue. If you have urgent questions, contact support",
  "systemId": "core"
}
